Configure Project/Command Line

Use the Configure Project dialog box (Admin | Configure Project | General Tab | Miscellaneous | Command Line) to set the command-line options, which control how the Serena ChangeMan Version Manager command-line interface operates. These options affect only the command-line interface. The options are:

  • Whether or not to display copyright and version information.
  • Whether to display detailed messages.
  • The command-line editor to use for entering workfile or change descriptions.
  • The name and location of the temporary file used for the prompt lines.
  • The suffix of message files.
  • Whether or not to delete message files after Version Manager reads them.

Field Descriptions

Miscellaneous | Command Line
Command Line Output Display sign on messages: Select to display copyright and version information when certain Version Manager commands are used, for example, the VCS command.

Display detailed messages: Select to display details of a command operation such as the workfile and archive names and the current and previous revision numbers.
Command Line Editor Editor: Enter the location and name of the executable for the text editor you want to use for entering workfile or change descriptions. If you do not specify an editor, Version Manager provides a simple internal line editor.

Temporary File: If you specify a command line editor to use, you must enter the location and name of a temporary file. Version Manager copies two prompt lines to the temporary file. When the editor runs, these prompt lines remind you what description you are entering. You should not change these prompt lines; Version Manager will delete them for you automatically if you do not change them. The temporary file is deleted after use.
Message Files Message File Suffix: Enter the suffix for message files. The default suffix is +-msg, which causes Version Manager to add the characters -msg to the end of the workfile name to create a message file name.

Delete message file after use - Select to delete message files after Version Manager reads them to obtain a change description.

See Also
